intro: Orthodon punctatus, commonly known as the punctate orthodon, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Orthodon punctatus is adapted to grow in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
